title: NBA Daily Fastbreak
subtitle: Your daily dose of NBA news and highlights for February 12, 2026

items.headline: Clippers Eye Kawhi Leonard Trade Amid Rebuild Speculation
items.summary: Following the blockbuster trade of James Harden to the Cavaliers, the Los Angeles Clippers are reportedly considering moving Kawhi Leonard as they potentially pivot towards a younger roster and prioritize financial flexibility. Leonard is under contract through the 2026-27 season.

items.headline: Harden's Stellar Debut with Cavs Hints at Championship Aspirations
items.summary: James Harden made a significant impact in his Cleveland Cavaliers home debut, dishing out 11 assists and showcasing his playmaking ability, which analysts believe could be key to the Cavs' championship pursuit.

items.headline: Deni Avdija Delivers All-Around Performance for Blazers
items.summary: Israeli standout Deni Avdija, now with the Portland Trail Blazers, had a brilliant outing on February 10th, recording 26 points, 10 rebounds, and 8 assists in a 135-118 win over the 76ers, showcasing his versatility upon returning from injury.

items.headline: Celtics Dominate Bulls Before All-Star Break
items.summary: Payton Pritchard led the Boston Celtics to a decisive 124-105 victory over the injury-riddled Chicago Bulls. Nikola Vucevic, playing against his former team, contributed 19 points and 11 rebounds for Boston.

items.headline: Leonard's Late Heroics Lift Clippers Past Rockets
items.summary: Kawhi Leonard's tie-breaking three-point play with two seconds left secured a 105-102 comeback win for the Los Angeles Clippers against the Houston Rockets. Leonard scored 19 of his game-high 27 points in the fourth quarter.

items.headline: Pistons Rout Raptors Despite Suspensions
items.summary: Cade Cunningham's 28 points propelled the Detroit Pistons to a 113-95 victory over the Toronto Raptors, even without suspended centers Isaiah Stewart and Jalen Duren.

items.headline: Cavs Crush Wizards in Harden's Home Debut
items.summary: The Cleveland Cavaliers extended their winning streak to five games with a dominant 138-113 win over the Washington Wizards. Sam Merrill shined with 26 points, including an NBA record-tying 7-for-7 from deep in the first half.

items.headline: Pacers Edge Nets in Close Contest
items.summary: The Indiana Pacers secured a narrow 115-110 victory over the Brooklyn Nets.

items.headline: Suns Snap Losing Streak Against Mavericks
items.summary: The Phoenix Suns ended their two-game losing streak by defeating the Dallas Mavericks 120-111.

items.headline: Wemby's Monster Night Powers Spurs Over Lakers
items.summary: Victor Wembanyama delivered a sensational performance with 40 points and 12 rebounds as the San Antonio Spurs routed the Los Angeles Lakers 136-108.

items.headline: Wemby's Dominant Double-Double
Leonard Leads Clippers Comeback
Cunningham's All-Around Excellence
Merrill Ties NBA Record in Scoring Spree
Pritchard Paces Celtics Attack
Avdija's Versatile Outing
Grizzlies Trade Jackson Jr., Hold onto Morant at Deadline
items.summary: The Memphis Grizzlies made a significant move at the trade deadline, dealing Jaren Jackson Jr. while electing to keep Ja Morant despite ongoing speculation and his struggles this season.

items.headline: Eastern Conference Leaders: Pistons and Celtics on Top
items.summary: As of February 11th, the Detroit Pistons lead the Eastern Conference with a 39-13 record, followed by the Boston Celtics at 34-19.

items.headline: Western Conference Race: Thunder Maintain Lead
items.summary: In the Western Conference, the Oklahoma City Thunder hold the top spot with a 41-13 record, with the San Antonio Spurs close behind at 37-16.

items.headline: Busy Trade Deadline Sees Star Players on the Move
items.summary: The 2026 NBA trade deadline witnessed several high-profile moves, including Trae Young joining the Wizards, Nikola Vucevic heading to the Celtics, Anthony Davis moving to the Wizards, and Chris Paul being traded to the Raptors.
